images.summary: This plan view shows the main floor layout of the Werkema Barn Addition. It includes structural elements such as W8x21 steel beams spaced at 20'-0" intervals and HSS 4"x4"x1/4" knee braces, which are typical at all locations. The plan indicates that no ceiling is intended for the addition, which is proposed for agricultural equipment storage. A continuous 2x6 "X" brace is fastened to the top or bottom of the bottom chord. The section callout A/A3 indicates a related section view. The text 'ADJUST POST AND BEAM (BOTH ROWS) HEIGHT TO ENSURE NEW ROOF TRUSS JOIN EXISTING BUILDING BELOW EXISTING EAVE' suggests modifications to align new structures with existing ones.

images.summary: This image provides a detailed view of the main floor plan for the Werkema Barn Addition. It features W8x21 steel beams and HSS 4"x4"x1/4" knee braces, typical at all locations. The plan specifies that no ceiling is intended for the addition, which is designated for equipment storage. A continuous 2x6 "X" brace is attached to the top or bottom of the bottom chord. The section callout A/A3 directs to a related section view. The note 'ADJUST POST AND BEAM (BOTH ROWS) HEIGHT TO ENSURE NEW ROOF TRUSS JOIN EXISTING BUILDING BELOW EXISTING EAVE' indicates necessary adjustments for structural alignment.

This elevation view illustrates the side of the Werkema Barn Addition, highlighting the structural columns and roof line. The image includes a snow shadow diagram indicating loads of 4.29 kPa and 1.53 kPa over a span of 22'-0". This provides insight into the snow load considerations for the roof design.

This elevation view shows the side of the Werkema Barn Addition, featuring structural columns and the roof line. A snow shadow diagram is present, indicating snow loads of 4.29 kPa and 1.53 kPa over a distance of 22'-0". This information is crucial for understanding the roof's load-bearing requirements.

images.summary: This section view illustrates a beam line detail for the Werkema Barn Addition. It includes various structural components such as steel roof cladding, 2x4 strapping, plywood, and steel siding. The detail specifies a full-height column at the beam intersection, with a double 2x6 continuous top plate. Concrete piers and footings are shown, with a minimum of 6 inches of compacted granular 'A' fill on undisturbed soil. The drawing notes the provision of 18-inch epoxied dowels embedded into existing footings and foundation walls. Knee braces and base plates are detailed, with truss tie-downs specified per truss manufacturer guidelines. The section emphasizes the need for stamped steel shop drawings for review by the project engineer, indicating the importance of these connection details for structural integrity.

images.summary: This section detail focuses on the knee brace connection for the Werkema Barn Addition. It specifies the use of (2) 2x6 or 2x8 plates secured to the beam with 1/2-inch bolts at 24 inches on center, with staggered sides of the flange. The detail includes a W10x22 beam and a steel angle measuring L 4" x 3" x 3/8" x 6" long. The knee brace is shown at a 45-degree angle, connecting to the column as per plan. The drawing also specifies the use of 2 x M20 ASTM A325 bolts, emphasizing the structural requirements for this connection.

images.summary: This foundation plan for the Werkema Barn Addition outlines the layout of footings and structural supports. It specifies not to undermine existing footings and details the provision of (2) 18-inch epoxied dowels, 24 inches long, embedded into existing footings and foundation walls. The plan includes dimensions for concrete piers and footings, such as 16"x16"x48" concrete piers with (4) #4 verticals and ties, and 48"x48"x24" concrete pad footings with reinforcement. The drawing emphasizes a minimum of 6 inches of compacted granular 'A' fill on undisturbed soil, crucial for load distribution at the foundation level.

It specifies not to undermine existing footings and details the provision of (2) 18-inch epoxied dowels, 24 inches long, embedded into existing footings and foundation walls. The plan includes dimensions for concrete piers and footings, such as 16"x16"x48" concrete piers with (4) #4 verticals and ties, and 48"x48"x24" concrete pad footings with reinforcement. This roof framing plan for the Werkema Barn Addition illustrates the layout of structural trusses. It provides a detailed view of the roof structure, essential for understanding the load distribution and support system. The plan is crucial for coordinating the installation of trusses and ensuring the structural integrity of the roof.

images.text_verbatim:
NOTES FOR BRACING OF ROOF
1 -- >> CONTRACTOR AND OR OWNER TO NOTIFY ENGINEER OF TRUSS DEFICIENCIES SUCH AS DAMAGED OR BROKEN TRUSS MEMBERS, AND MISSING OR OFFSET TRUSS PLATES.
2 -- >> DIAGONAL BRACING MUST BE PROVIDED ON ALL WEB MEMBERS REQUIRING BRACING. DIAGONAL BRACING SHALL BE SPACED AS REQUIRED BY THE BRACING DESIGNER. LATERAL & X-BRACING SHALL BE PROVIDED @ ENDWALLS @ INTERVALS INDICATED BY ENGINEER.
3 -- >> PERMANENT LATERAL BRACING TO BE INSTALLED ON WEB MEMBERS AS INDICATED BY ENGINEER.
4 -- >> PROVIDE DIAGONAL BRACING @ ALL DISCONTINUITIES IN BRACING SUCH AS WHERE TRUSS TYPE CHANGES
5 -->> THE TRUSS SUPPLIER SHALL DESIGN THE TRUSSES FOR THE LOADING NOTED. BRACING DETAILS WILL NOT BE MODIFIED UNLESS APPROVED BY THE ENGINEER.
STRAPPING OR SHEATHING ON ROOF DECK SPACED AS SPECIFIED BY TRUSS ENGINEER (2x4 Lumber)
SPACING AS SPECIFIED BY BRACE DESIGNER 48'-0" MAXIMUM
2x4 STRUT x 5'-0" LONG @ TOP & BOTTOM WITH TWO OF 3 1/2" NAILS @ EACH TRUSS WEB MEMBER
ANCHOR 2x4 DIAGONAL BRACE TO LATERAL WITH FOUR OF 3 1/2" NAILS @ INTERSECTION OF TRUSS WEB & TRUSS LATERAL
2x4 DIAGONAL "X" BRACE ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF TRUSS AT ENDWALLS & WHERE SPECIFIED ELSEWHERE
ANCHOR 2x4 DIAGONAL "X" ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF WEB WITH TWO OF 3 1/2" NAILS @ EACH TRUSS
2x4 DIAGONAL BRACING SPACED AS REQUIRED BY THE BRACING DESIGNER
TRUSS TOP CHORD
TRUSS BOTTOM CHORD
TRUSS WEB MEMBER
LAP 2x4 DIAGONAL (Min. 2 TRUSSES) TO ENSURE DIAGONAL BRACE EXTENDS COMPLETELY FROM TOP CHORD TO BOTTOM CHORD OF TRUSS. (AS REQUIRED)
BUTT 2x4 LATERALS @ ALL SPLICE LOCATIONS. ENSURE BUTT JOINT IS TIGHT & CENTERED ON TRUSS WEB.
images.summary: This image contains notes and a diagram related to the bracing of roof trusses. The notes specify that contractors or owners must notify engineers of any truss deficiencies, such as damaged or broken members and missing or offset plates. Diagonal bracing is required on all web members needing bracing, with spacing determined by the bracing designer. Lateral and X-bracing should be provided at endwalls as indicated by the engineer. Permanent lateral bracing is to be installed on web members as specified. Diagonal bracing must be provided at all discontinuities, such as changes in truss type. The truss supplier is responsible for designing the trusses for the specified loading, and any modifications to bracing details require engineer approval. The diagram illustrates the use of 2x4 struts and diagonals, with specific nailing requirements. Strapping or sheathing on the roof deck is to be spaced as specified by the truss engineer, with a maximum spacing of 48'-0". The diagram shows the truss top chord, bottom chord, and web members, with instructions for anchoring diagonal braces and ensuring proper lap and butt joint connections. Key components include truss top and bottom chords, truss web members, diagonal bracing, 2x4 struts, and laterals.
